alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 6:53PM CDT until March 31 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN JO DAVIESS AND NORTHWESTERN STEPHENSON COUNTIES... At 652 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Waddams Grove, or 15 miles west of Freeport, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Lena and Lake Le-Aqua-na State Park around 700 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Winslow, Mc Connell and Oneco. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
